title: Wrist Dice
summary: The easiest way to roll dice
description: This is an easy-to-use random number generator made for rolling common dice for games including Dungeons and Dragons. Tap on the screen to roll the die, or swipe left and right to pick a different die. The voice bar can be used to issue voice commands within the app.FEATURES- Android Wear support - Use the command "Start Wrist Dice" to open it up. It looks good on round and square devices.- Voice commands - Just say "roll a d8" or "flip a coin". It just works!- Customize - Dice appear as round, or square. Change the shape on your watch as well!- Roll a d4, d6, d8, d10, d12, d20, d100, and flip a coin!
descriptionHTML:
This is an easy-to-use random number generator made for rolling common dice for games including Dungeons and Dragons. Tap on the screen to roll the die, or swipe left and right to pick a different die. The voice bar can be used to issue voice commands within the app.

FEATURES
- Android Wear support - Use the command "Start Wrist Dice" to open it up. It looks good on round and square devices.
- Voice commands - Just say "roll a d8" or "flip a coin". It just works!
- Customize - Dice appear as round, or square. Change the shape on your watch as well!
- Roll a d4, d6, d8, d10, d12, d20, d100, and flip a coin!
comments: Best dice rolling for wear so far.
Works well with LG Urbane Just got the LG watch Urbane and this app works pretty well. Obviously would be nicer to see animation of a d20 but all works well (especially voice mode).
Works well on the moto 360 I would really like a 3d dice program for my watch, but this one works well in the meantime.

Massive issues on live gear App is a great idea, but it causes "watch is notifications" to repeatedly flash on the watch and general crashing of many other things on the app, as well massive battery drain. I'm assuming it's some kind of looping crash or looping logic that's causing the issue. Sorry to say had to reset my watch to factory twice because of this application. Oh and it doesn't like to remove itself. Stays resident when application removed from phone, and just shows a loading screen for thirty seconds or so then closes out
